reviews.text: I stayed at the Guymon Comfort Inn on business in the area in June 2007. Everything was very clean and modern. The room had a couch and coffee table, microwave and refrigerator, and a DVD player (there are movies available to rent at front desk).
reviews.title: Very modern and nice

reviews.text: Beds were very comfortable and there were four pillows per bed.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: I was on my way home from Phoenix, AZ and this was my halfway point. I could not believe how accommodating the staff was to 1. let me stay there even though I was 18 and 2. wait for me to arrive extremely late at night. The room was similar to a room you would see at a luxury resort. Truly a diamond in the rough!
reviews.title: Teen on the way home from a 30 hr drive

reviews.text: Reserved weeks n advance. Ask specifically for ground floor, 2 rooms very close, side by side or ajoining. Upon arrival was told not only couldn't get rooms sbs or even close... we were stuck on 2 different levels, traveling w/ children, and a special needs person. I explained this to the clerk...and told her I was assured we could be accomodated when we made the reservation...I ask to speak w/the mgr and was told she had left that afternoon for vacation and would have to takeit up w/corporate later. It was very late, didn't want to risk no rooms on down the rd so we checked in. Our stay was for 2 nights. The pool was filthy, the hot tub cold. One room was clean, the other looked like it hadn't seen a sweeper in weeks. We asked for tissue and towels...one room was w/out...never came...we had to go down and get them ourselves. I ask about the pool / HT and was given the ...really...I had no idea line. Will never stay there again...new Best Western is really nice for less. I wrote a letter to corp office...they just forwarded to the it Mgr who sent me an emailing stating basically sorry, don't know what else to say...come back and I will give you 10% your next stay....don't think so...Our Suburban had gas siffened out of the tank while parked in the lot.
reviews.title: Lazy and Rude...

reviews.text: Originally, I discounted this hotel because of the review regarding bed bugs, but I needed a place between Dodge City and Albuquerque for the night and this place was convenient. I'm so glad we went for this.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable. Nice surprise in a dull town.

reviews.text: Not a bed bug to be seen, though I got up several times in the night to check. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast could have been better - only a few pieces of fruit were available, but the kids enjoyed the waffles and pastries. No eggs. The clerk told me they are working on getting the equipment to keep them at the proper temperature. Speaking of clerks, the clerk who checked us in was a sweetie and recommended a nearby family restaurant - J & J - which turned out to be a tasty and economical option for dinner.
reviews.title: it was the best hotel in guymon

reviews.text: There's nothing to do in Guymon, but the hotel does offer DVDs to view for free in the room. They are an older but solid collection.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Pleasant

likes.disliked: — Breakfast and lack of instructions for access the internet
